intro: Aetheopappus raddeanus, commonly known as the velvetleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features robust, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Aetheopappus raddeanus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
